CommandDefinition.Name: starttimecontrolledorder
CommandDefinition.Description: Register and start a new Time Controlled Order.
CommandDefinition.ExtendedDescription:
Optional CalendarDefinition ======================== The calendarDefinition can be specified as a list of time units with conditions, separated by semicolons and enclosed by square brackets. The following time units are allowed: Millisecond, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, DayOfMonth, Month, Year. Examples: * [Hour=20;Minute=15;DayOfWeek=SAT] starts every Saturday at 20:15 an order * [Hour=:2] starts every two hours an order * [Day=2#MON;Month=JAN] starts always on the second Monday in January an order
Optional InputPayloadFile ============== The optional Input consists of one or more Data-Tags. Each of the Data-Tags has the following attributes: IsList : Indicates that the data is a list holding multiple values ReferenceName : The Data-Type of the Input ReferencePath : Path where the Data-Type is located VariableName : Name of the member variable the Data is assigned to (must match the variable name specified in the definition of the Data-Type)
Each Data-Tag can either hold exactly one Value-Tag or one or more other Data-Tags, if the Data-Type is complex. If the nested Data is primitive it only has the VariableName-Attribute referencing to the member variable of the complex Data. In that case the VariableName must match the name of the member variable.
If the input data is a list then the Data-Tag gets the IsList-Attribute which is set to true. In that case the Data-Tag is followed by one or more Value-Tags where each holds the same type of Data.
The inner most Value-Tag holds a literal that is interpreted as the primitive data of the member variable it is being assigned to.
A sample input XML-file might look like this:
<Input> <Data ReferenceName="mdmDataType" ReferencePath="mdmPath" VariableName="varName"> <Data VariableName="memberVarName"> <Value>value</Value> </Data> ... </Data> <Data IsList="true" ReferenceName="mdmDataListType" ReferencePath="mdmPath" VariableName="varNameList"> <Value> <Data VariableName="memberVarName"> <Value>value</Value> </Data> ... </Value> <Value> <Data VariableName="memberVarName"> <Value>value</Value> </Data> ... </Value> ... </Data> ... </Input>

Argument.Name: label
Argument.Description: A name for the new Time Controlled Order

Argument.Name: orderType
Argument.Description: The ordertype of the order to be started by the Time Controlled Order

Argument.Name: calendarDefinition
Argument.Description: Times at which the order will be executed. If not set, the order will be executed only once.

Argument.Name: firstExecutionTime
Argument.Description: Date and time of the first execution. Use the value '0' to execute immediately. Supported inputs are ISO Timestamp YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[,f] and the milliseconds since 1970 for absolute times. For relative times only milliseconds since 1970 are supported.

Argument.Name: timeZone
Argument.Description: Time zone associated with the first execution time. Only valid if the interval is a multiple of 24h. If no time zone is provided the first execution time is assumed to be in UTC.

BoolOption.Name: dst
BoolOption.Description: If the provided time zone has daylight saving time, then it is taken into account when executing intervals that are multiple of days.

BoolOption.Name: r
BoolOption.Description: Interpret the firstExecutionTime as a relative millisecond value.

BoolOption.Name: d
BoolOption.Description: Create the order in disabled status

Argument.Name: onError
Argument.Description: Behavior if an error occurs. Allowed values are 'Disable', 'Drop' and 'Ignore'.

Argument.Name: inputPayloadFile
Argument.Description: Location of the file containing the payload that is used to execute the Time Controlled Order. Format: <Input><Data>...</Data><Data>...</Data></Input> (see callservice documentation)

Argument.Name: applicationName
Argument.Description: The application the ordertype belongs to.

Argument.Name: versionName
Argument.Description: The version of the application the ordertype belongs to.

Argument.Name: custom0
Argument.Description: Sets the custom0 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom1
Argument.Description: Sets the custom1 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom2
Argument.Description: Sets the custom2 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom3
Argument.Description: Sets the custom3 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: workspaceName
Argument.Description: The workspace the ordertype belongs to.
